intro: Runcina, commonly known as the common runcina, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stem and compound leaves that are often finely divided. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Runcina is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in meadows and woodland edges. It is generally considered a herbaceous perennial with a moderate growth habit.
